title: 114_hr3961
content: The "Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act of 2015" mandates the Bureau of Labor Statistics to create a monthly index reflecting spending changes for individuals aged 62 and above in the U.S. Appropriations are authorized for this purpose, and the index will be effective from July 31 of the year following the Act's enactment. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act include adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act involve adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. This includes inserting new provisions related to the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act of 2015. The amendments made to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. The effective date for these amendments is specified to apply to determinations made after September 30 of the second calendar year following the enactment of the Act. The Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act of 2015 is amended to adjust monthly insurance benefits for individuals aged 62 and above. The amendments apply to accounting years ending before and after October 1 of the second calendar year following the enactment of the Act. The Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act of 2015 is amended to adjust monthly insurance benefits for individuals aged 62 and above by replacing the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers with the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers in various sections of the Act. The Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act of 2015 is amended to adjust monthly insurance benefits for individuals aged 62 and above by replacing the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers with the applicable consumer price index in various sections of the Act. This includes updating references to the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers in specific sections of the Act. In the amendments, the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers is substituted for the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers in multiple sections of the Act. The amendments replace the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers with the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers in section 1886(h)(5)(B) of the Act, effective for determinations made after December 31 of the second calendar year following the enactment of the Act.
